title: How to Speak Like a Chavette (Female Chav)

steps.title: Watch programs like The Only Way Is Essex and Educating Essex.
steps.content: Watch programs like The Only Way Is Essex and Educating Essex. Also, try to find any of the 'Diary of a Chav' books by Grace Dent - They are a big help! [1] X Research source

steps.title: Start picking it up slowly.
steps.content: Start picking it up slowly. Instead of saying 'how are you' to a friend say 'All right' (Should be pronounced Aw rate ) Also, instead of saying someone's name, call them 'babes' or 'bruv' (Works for BOTH genders!)

steps.title: Every time you are going to say 'isn't it', say 'Innit' and change 'was' for 'were'.
steps.content: Every time you are going to say 'isn't it', say 'Innit' and change 'was' for 'were'. This will help to get into the habit of saying it.

steps.title: Try saying "was like", whenever you would have said, "said".
steps.content: Try saying "was like", whenever you would have said, "said". Especially within a monologue : for example, "I was like... an' she was like.... an' 'e was like .... "

steps.title: Never say, "here you are".
steps.content: Never say, "here you are". Instead : "'ere you go !" [2] X Research source

steps.title: Never issue an invitation, to a meeting.
steps.content: Never issue an invitation, to a meeting. It's an invite to a meet, innit ! [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add 'like,' 'well' and 'proper' into your sentences.
steps.content: Add 'like,' 'well' and 'proper' into your sentences. for example: "That were a well good lesson! Ms________ is a proper good teacher, like!" This will make you sound natural.

steps.title: Don't go round shouting 'That were proper good innit bruv!'
steps.content: Don't go round shouting 'That were proper good innit bruv!' This will make you look fake and stupid. Instead, try out one new word at a time. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Stop pronouncing 'h'.
steps.content: Stop pronouncing 'h'. Aitches are to be dropped (this has no chav status in North/Midlands, where it's normal). [5] X Research source But when saying the letter aitch, pronounce it "haitch" (ditto)

steps.title: Be casual!
steps.content: Be casual! Don't act like you're trying too hard!
